conbody.p: A radio button is a round circle, usually with a label next to it, that represents an option. Using the mouse, you can select the option (a dark circle is displayed) or remove the option (no dark circle is displayed). Unlike checkboxes, radio buttons are used for mutually exclusive options. This means that you can only make one selection from a list of options.

Radio button can be used for:
Navigating in the application: For instance, checking the radio button conditions the display of the current or next page. In that case, there is no data linked to the radio button.
Setting a value to an attribute: The attribute data type can be an enumeration or a Boolean. For an attribute based on enumeration, each radio button provides selection of one of the enumerated values.
